title: Old Fashioned Pineapple Upside-Down Cake Recipe
description: This upside-down pineapple cake is made with an easy homemade cake baked in a skillet with pineapple, cherries, and brown sugar until caramelized.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Fruit Desserts Pineapple Dessert Recipes Old Fashioned Pineapple Upside-Down Cake 4.3 (533) 447 Reviews 213 Photos This upside-down pineapple cake recipe delivers a really good take on the classic, old-fashioned dessert. Submitted by Cathy Updated on February 21, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 213 213 213 213 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Additional Time: 5 mins Total Time: 1 hr Servings: 12 Yield: 1 10-inch round cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings ½ cup butter 1 cup packed light brown sugar 1 (20 ounce) can sliced pineapple 10 maraschino cherries, halved 1 cup sifted cake flour 1 teaspoon baking powder ¼ teaspoon salt 4 large eggs 1 cup white sugar 1 tablespoon butter, melted 1 teaspoon almond extract Directions Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Melt 1/2 cup butter over very low heat in a 10-inch heavy skillet with a heat-resistant handle or a cast iron pan. Remove from heat; sprinkle brown sugar evenly into the skillet. Arrange pineapple slices to cover the bottom of the skillet. Distribute cherries around pineapples; set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sift together flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl; set aside. Separate eggs; place whites in a large mixing bowl and yolks in a smaller bowl. Beat egg whites on medium speed until soft peaks form. Add white sugar gradually, beating well after each addition. Beat until medium-stiff peaks form. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat egg yolks at high speed until very thick and yellow. Using a wire whisk or rubber scraper, gently fold egg yolks and flour mixture into whites with an over-and-under motion until blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Fold 1 tablespoon melted butter and almond extract into batter, then spread batter evenly over pineapple in the skillet. Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Loosen cake edges with a table knife. Cool cake for 5 minutes before inverting it onto a serving plate. Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 1,156 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 321 Calories 10g Fat 55g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 321 % Daily Value * Total Fat 10g 13% Saturated Fat 6g 30% Cholesterol 85mg 28% Sodium 183mg 8% Total Carbohydrate 55g 20% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 43g Protein 3g 6% Vitamin C 5mg 5% Calcium 52mg 4% Iron 2mg 8% Potassium 69mg 1% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Old Fashioned Pineapple Upside-Down Cake 01 of 213 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 213 Photo by  Tina Gadd 12/03/2024 It's definitely delicious! I'd like the cake to be a little more moist, but maybe that's because I cooked it a little longer than recommended due to having a smaller pan and the center not being done. 03 of 213 Photo by  SmartBran8948 01/03/2024 I had fresh pineapple so I used half of one and I pretty much chopped and shredded it up also I had no cake flour so I use all purpose flour it's really good... Almost too good to miss the picture but I caught it.lol 04 of 213 Photo by  Susan Harvey 03/05/2023 It was really good. I Like this recipe. 05 of 213 Photo by  CaringPoke5337 08/31/2022 I used Krusteaz gluten free flour and it worked just as well! 06 of 213 Photo by  Sharon Stolte 06/25/2022 It was so easy. For my son's birthday as its his favorite. 07 of 213 Photo by  BriskWhey3923 06/10/2022 Easy, turned out great 08 of 213 Photo by  Joan Mathews McDaniel 11/14/2021 Turned out delicious! My pineapple was fresh and cut into chunks so it’s not as pretty… 09 of 213 Photo by  Stephen Headrick 10/25/2021 Very easy recipe, impressive final product, and tastes great 10 of 213 Photo by  Cyndi Stewart 07/11/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Cream of Coconut Pineapple Upside-Down Cake 2 Ratings Grandma's Pineapple Upside-Down Cake 57 Ratings Spicy Pineapple Upside Down Cake 6 Ratings Fresh Pineapple Upside Down Cake 357 Ratings Pineapple Upside-Down Pound Cake 7 Ratings Fresh Strawberry Upside Down Cake 746 Ratings Pineapple Upside Down Cupcakes 282 Ratings Chef John's Pineapple Upside-Down Cake 135 Ratings Pineapple Upside-Down Cheesecake 7 Ratings Grilled Pineapple Upside Down Cake 5 Ratings Pineapple Upside-Down Cake from Scratch 9 Ratings Grandma's Skillet Pineapple Upside-Down Cake 62 Ratings Pineapple Upside-Down Cake 1,011 Ratings Pineapple Upside-Down Bundt Cake 97 Ratings Pineapple Upside-Down Cake II 294 Ratings Pineapple Upside-Down Cake III 130 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
